author: jochembrouwer
content: Ok docker novice question, how do I wipe the docker data and restart it? I want to restart the ethereumjs teku instance from scratch. If I restart it, it just runs into the same issue, so I think data got corrupted

author: pk910
content:
stop the container, clear the datadir and start it again ğŸ™‚
if it's one of our devnet nodes, the data is usually located in `/data/ethereumjs`

author: marioevz
content:
EEST Devnet-5 1.3.0 release tracker here: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/issues/1094

Some EEST PRs still need to be merged but we're working on it ğŸ‘ 

I think a decision needs to be made over https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/9248 because if we include that change in the 1.3.0 it would break compatibility with current running devnet client versions.

author: jochembrouwer
content: I have no strong preference, I think it depends on if we want to launch devnet-6 with this change ASAP or that we want to keep running devnet-5 for some time (seems there are bugs and forks, so these should be debugged and fixed anyways). EthJS has a branch ready for devnet-6 with the 7702 code change (fun fact: I only had to delete logic): https://github.com/ethereumjs/ethereumjs-monorepo/pull/3839

author: parithosh
content: likely we have some time for bugfixes + passing hive tests
